result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon Todd Sutherland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Felony) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs, surcharges, restitution & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.
Costs, surcharges, restitution & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.
May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.
Defendant shall obtain & maintain full time employment, school enrollment or combination of the two.

NO CONTACT WITH: persons under 18 years of age without prior agent approval, but he may have unsupervised contact with family members O.S.S. & J.M.S & B.A.S & E.S.

NO use of computers, internet or social media applications without prior agent approval.

May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County without permission of the agent.

Defendant shall undergo treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Johnathon Todd Sutherland, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Joseph Pecora.
Shelly Rusch appeared as prosecuting attorney with victim specialist.  DOC agent, Elizabeth.
PSI received by parties - no additions/corrections noted.    State complied with Act 81 Victim Witness Notification.
State addresses sentencing recommendation.  References Victim's statement and request for immediate jail condition.

Defendant, Sutherland, makes a statement to the court.
Court sentences.    Defendant advised of voting rights.    Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
Defendant's case not eligible for expunction.  Defendant not required to register with sex offender.

Johnathon Todd Sutherland, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Joseph Pecora.
Shelly Rusch appeared as prosecuting attorney.

 Elements stated.  Factual basis found.

Joseph Pecora appearing on behalf of defendant.
Johnathon Todd Sutherland, defendant does not appear.

Johnathon Todd Sutherland, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Joseph Pecora.

Violation -  Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts; 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child.   Issuing Agency -  DOJ.
  May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County or Rock County or Dane County without permission of Court except to travel to sister's, Katie Zigman, residence located near Appleton WI.
NO CONTACT WITH: persons under 18 years of age except family members named O.S.S & J.M.S. & B.A.S & E.S except contact with a minor child when one parent of the minor child is present.
  NO CONTACT WITH:  victim Jayne, whose victim ID notice is confidential and accessible to be viewed by defense only upon their request.
Not to access to social media sites or social media applications and no possession or use of cellular devices that have access to those same sites or applications, except use of smart phone solely for employment purposes and use.
